attributes.action: Ensure that fireworks remain unrestricted to the general public.
attributes.background: A petition to ensure that the general public can (and in future will be able to) purchase fireworks for home displays without undue restrictions.

attributes.action: Stop putting the clocks forward for British Summertime (BST) leave UK on GMT
attributes.background: The clocks changing for British Summertime started 100 years ago. The UK did this when Germany started doing it, apparently it was to save coal. Farmers have lights on their tractors and lights in their cattle sheds so this only serves to cause a nuisance for most of us. Especially those with kids

attributes.action: Reinstate George Osborne's plan to set up a 2nd hand annuity market
attributes.background: People have been waiting nearly two years to be able to sell their poor monthly payments for cash lump sums where they can make a difference to their lives.   For example, I've sat with no working boiler as I can't afford one without my annuity funds in one payment.

attributes.action: Full pension rights for people thrown out  of the navy for living with ts person
attributes.background: Living with ts person was illegal back in 82, I was kicked out for this crime but I was 21 at the time and doing nothing wrong under cival law, now a days you get to stay in if you fall in love with a ts.I find it repugnent not to eben have had a simple sorry from the powers that be.

attributes.action: No confidence vote in Amber Rudd for denying visa to bone marrow donor.
attributes.background: May Brown, 23, from Dorset, who has leukaemia, has been told that her Nigerian sister Martha is a "10 out of 10" tissue match.  However, the Home Office denied a visa because "all visa applications must be assessed against the immigration rules".
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-dorset-37656377

attributes.action: Increase the number of specialist road traffic officers to reduce road deaths
attributes.background: 10,732 people died on UK roads between 2010 and 2015. In the period Jan to March 2016 alone saw a 14% increase in reported road deaths. Without the fear of detection, non-compliance of road safety rules and laws is noticeably increasing. Enforcement is no longer supporting education or engineering
attributes.additional_details:
"The level of enforcement on our roads is woefully inadequate, 
between 2010 and 2014 the UK has seen a 27% reduction in the number of specialist road traffic police on the roads (falling from 5,338 to 3,901) outside of London". Brake-the road safety charity
Without a visible police presence, road users no longer fear being caught and are increasing non-compliant and yet detection rates are falling
Between 2010-15 133,565 people were seriously injured
Motor insurers paid out £27m per day in 2015

attributes.action: To change the laws on criminals being prosecuted on the account of rape.
attributes.background: This petition is to change the minimum jail sentence length and to rule out community service as a legitimate charge. Victims dealing with cases such as this deserve to be able to go about their lives as they wish, without having the fear of running into their offenders.
attributes.additional_details: Personally, I don't think that community service is an appropriate sentence for someone being convicted of rape. The victims and their families would have been put through hell and the perpetrator receiving community service for however long is basically letting them get away with it, when the victims deserve a lot more justice for the crime that was committed.

attributes.action: Make it law to carry a breakdown warning triangle in every motor vehicle.
attributes.background: If a warning triangle is displayed 100 metres behind a broken down vehicle, it will decrease the chances of someone else crashing into it. What if you had broken down somewhere awkward like a roundabout or a bridge without a hard shoulder?
attributes.additional_details:
It is already mandatory in France to carry a warning triangle.

It alerts other road users to a breakdown so they have enough time to react.

It is very effective on motorways where there is no hard shoulder.

It is known to reduce the amount of accidents involving broken down vehicles.

attributes.action: Publish all registered sex offenders names, addresses and nature of crime.
attributes.background: America allows all law enforcement to publish to the public the names, addresses and crimes committed by all sex offenders.  we as the UK public should be able to have this information to keep our kids safe.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Megan%27s_Law Link to background info on Megan's law this has been running successfully for many years and is proof that it works! The united kingdom public should be informed in order to protect our children if we don't know where they are how can we protect our vulnerable members of society.

attributes.action: Do not impose the Bedroom Tax on Pensioners
attributes.background: Pensioners have paid Taxes all their working lives now in their latter years with low state Pensions cannot afford to pay an unfair cut in Housing Benefit which is another form of Poll Tax.
attributes.additional_details: The Tory Government is soon to impose the Bedroom Tax on Pensioners by cutting Housing Benefit to OAPS that have extra bedrooms they say people don't use. Some couples need to sleep alone because of different ailments they have so need the extra bedroom, there is not enough Social Housing to rehouse everybody its Social Blackmail which is not Fair on people who have paid Taxes all their working lives and are about to be hit with an unfair Tax in their Twilight Years when they don't need the worry of it all

attributes.action: Abolish psychiatric electroconvulsive therapy – ECT - electroshock to the brain
attributes.background: ECT causes brain cell death, brain bleed and swelling. It can cause permanent memory loss, cognitive impairment and even death. It can trigger suicide. ECT machines have never been independently inspected or approved for medical safety, not even by the regulators for the UK - MHRA or the US – FDA.
attributes.additional_details: Electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) is a psychiatric procedure where up to 400 volts is put through the brain for up to 8 seconds causing an epileptic fit purportedly to relieve mental distress.   Mainly given to women and the elderly, sometimes to children and often without consent.  Patients are rarely fully informed about the potential harm.  Dr Peter Breggin states ECT produces a ‘closed head injury high’ www.ectresources.org. Abolish ECT. www.speakoutagainstpsychiatry.org

attributes.action: Government should put a stop to paying of TV licence in the UK!!
attributes.background:
Government should put a stop to paying of tv licence because is not acceptable!
I have lived in spain and other parts of eu country and they don't ask their citizens to pay for TV licence. 
You can make research for yourself.
attributes.additional_details: Most eu countries don't ask for TV licence.

attributes.action: Change to Western European time to take advantage of 1hr extra evening daylight
attributes.background: Conversion to Western European time would give one hour additional evening daylight throughout the year. Western France, much of Spain and all of Portugal are to the west of the UK and yet they are 1hr ahead. It would also have a business advantage of harmonising UK time with Western Europe.

attributes.action: Give British people a say in our post-referendum relationship with the EU
attributes.background: The EU referendum gave the option of leaving or remaining in the EU. The options in reality are more nuanced and there is a risk of the British populace getting an unsatisfactory outcome. Given the lies of the pre-referendum campaigning we need honesty about the future of Britain and further say.
attributes.additional_details:
We need to know, and have a say on:
Whether further austerity measures might be necessary after leaving the EU: www.just-fair.co.uk/#!United-Nations-Austerity-policies-breach-the-UK%E2%80%99s-international-human-rights-obligations/qbw0c/577384fa0cf231749dc9f955
How immigration will be affected www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-37271420
Whether the NHS will be better off by £350 million per week
Whether the United Kingdom will split up
How our successful science base will be protected

attributes.action: Give prison officers stab vests
attributes.background: British prisons are getting more and more dangerous and weapons like make-shift knives are sometimes used. Better prepare and protect prison officers by giving them stab vests.

attributes.action: Better Pay for nurses just like paramedics
attributes.background: It was debated in parliament in 2016 fairer pay for paramedics because of the work they do. Their pay has been risen to band 6. So why can't parliament increase pay the same for nurses.

attributes.action: Commemorate Women in the Palace of Westminster
attributes.background: On a visit to the Palace of Westminster yesterday, a woman commented online that "I walked passed at least 200 pictures & statues on my way to the committee room. Other than a pic of Elizabeth 1 & another including 6 Henry-wives, there were no women. Not good enough."
attributes.additional_details:
On International Women's Day, it is time for parliament to recognise the impact and positive influence that women have made throughout history and continue to make in modern society.

Many of these women's incredible achievements have been despite the lack of support & recognition from society.  Let's stop that now.

Time to include women.

We call upon parliament to include women through it's hall and walls.

What do we want our young boys & girls to see when they visit? Their future. Together.

attributes.action: Introduce an extra £1 per week from tax payers to fund the NHS after BREXIT
attributes.background: I paid my taxes since leaving school in 1987 and never needed the NHS, but after having a Stroke in 2016 have realised how valuable and amazing our NHS and its staff are. I propose a £1 per week tax to help increase staff wages and encourage new employees. We have something special let's keep it.
attributes.additional_details: Queens Hospital, Romford, Essex

attributes.action: Reconsider A27 improvement options including a northern route
attributes.background: The A27 around Chichester is a nightmare and finally we had some options but not a Northern Route which the majority wanted. The Transport Department should give us new options but the Minister has blocked it.

attributes.action: Make tobacco/cigarettes illegal in the UK
attributes.background: Tobacco has been proven to have a plethora of negatives effects on the health. If the government/'experts' have the audacity to ban cannabis for its effects even with the added benefit, tobacco/cigarettes should also be banned with the lack of benefits of smoking it.

attributes.action: Develop a train service from Sheerness to Leysdown
attributes.background: The isle of Sheppey has recently seen a huge development in Neatscourt retail park near Queenborough, but the infrastructure has not been developed to allow residents from perhaps Leysdown to access it. If there was a train with multiple stops across the island, people would access its shops easier.

attributes.action: Make 'name blind' recruitment a legal requirement
attributes.background:
The Equality Act 2010 made discrimination based on race, religion, gender, disability and sexual orientation illegal. 

Yet employers routinely discriminate against those with a foriegn sounding name on their cvs despite them having identical qualifications to other candidates. This must end now.
attributes.additional_details:
A recent BBC report stated that candidates with an ‘English-sounding name’ could be offered three times the number of interviews than an applicant with a Muslim name with the same qualifications.

Similarly, those with African or Caribbean sounding names are equally discriminated against as are women:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/38751307?client=ms-android-orange-gb. 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/34636464?client=ms-android-orange-gb.

This creates an unequal society for UK citizens.

attributes.action: Demand a stop to potential closure of Glenfield children's heart unit
attributes.background: The children's heart unit at Glenfield Hospital is being threatened with closure. If this is carried out, what would it mean for some children? How might they cope in a situation of having no hospital near them to go to in an emergency?

attributes.action: Change the University Maintenance Loan back to the Maintenance Grant.
attributes.background: The University Fee of £9000 as well as the Maintenance Loan. An average student will be paying £15000-£17000 per year. The country could potentially be losing out on many individuals with academical excellence due to these devastating state of affairs.

attributes.action: Stop nurseries charging fees when children are sick or on holiday.
attributes.background: Many nurseries charge 100% fees when a child does not attend due to sickness or holiday. They even sell the session to other parents, doubling their profit. This expense can put some parents off returning to work and make family holidays less affordable.

attributes.action: Ban the importation and distribution of all dyed fish.
attributes.background: Dyeing fish is completely unatural and inhumane. Fish that have been injected with these dyes suffer a dramatically shortened life span and are much more susceptible to infection and disease. It is said that in most cases only 50% of fish actually survive the procedure.
attributes.additional_details: Reference - http://www.pets4homes.co.uk/pet-advice/the-phenomenon-of-dyed-fish-and-how-to-avoid-it.html

attributes.action: Fine neglectful parents who send there children to school when child is unwell.
attributes.background: Change the law and fine parents that send there child to school when the child is unwell or ill. Not meeting the child's needs is classed as neglect. Children will not learn when they feel poorly and they spread germs to other healthy children.
attributes.additional_details:
Neglect
In this type of child maltreatment there is a failure to provide for a child's basic physical or emotional needs, which is likely to damage the child's health or development.
Not helping a child to have the medical care or treatment that they need. This includes having their normal routine immunisations and attending hospital appointments. It also includes not giving them medication which has been prescribed.

Copy from in part.  http://patient.info/health/safeguarding-children

attributes.action: Make law that parents are financially accountable for their childrens behaviour
attributes.background: Parents have a duty to bring up our children to be good law abiding citizens. But laws do not encourage this, a child can be brought up an cause, criminal damage, theft and even hospitalise people without any come back on the parents. Adults need to be accountable for parenting performance.
attributes.additional_details: Poorly brought up children cost the country and tax payers a vast amount of money. Graffitti alone in London last year cost over £100m, criminal damage, theft and crimes relating to injury should all hold the parents financially accountable. Criminal damage by children is not paid for by the parents, so insurance goes up. Unless the laws of this country encourage the outcome we want then some parents will continue to perform badly as parents and future generations will suffer.

attributes.action: Create fair & honest revenue stream for NHS & social care with hypothecated tax
attributes.background: It's time UK govt & people had a grown-up relationship with NHS and social care funding. Replace NI contributions with a stand alone tax to fund NHS & social care. The people would then see the true costs and politicians could say how much or how little they were willing to raise in their manifesto
attributes.additional_details: Obviously not all tax revenue comes from people's income. There would still be a proportion coming from Corporation, Value Added and other tax raising streams. However these proportions could be protected so the percentage of burden on the population's income always remains the same.

attributes.action: Support Community Radio/Media organisations with a substantive funding increase.
attributes.background: There are now over 240 Ofcom licensed Community Radio/Media organisations across the UK, many of whom are struggling and increasingly having to commercialise their operations to survive, against the spirit and original intent of Community Radio since inception in 2002/04. http://tiny.cc/comradiofund
attributes.additional_details: In addition to a substantive funding increase, a relaxation in the associated constraints on Community Radio Fund grant use (ie. what it can and cannot be spent on) is also sought. http://tiny.cc/comradiofund

attributes.action: Reform the law to secure greater equality for transgender and non-binary people
attributes.background:
Trans and non-binary people face inequality in the law and unacceptable levels of discrimination in society. 

The UK government must reform the law to extend discrimination protections, improve gender recognition rights, and give the Scottish Parliament powers to protect & extend LGBTI equality.
attributes.additional_details:
Specifically this petition calls on the UK government to:
 
• Update the Equality Act 2010 to ensure all trans and non-binary people are fully protected from discrimination.
 
• Reform the Gender Recognition Act 2004 in line with international best practice, and scrap the spousal veto, to ensure all trans and non-binary people are able to access their human right to legal gender recognition.
 
• Devolve equality law to Scotland so the Scottish Parliament can protect and extend LGBTI equality.

attributes.action: Keep dove house in bushy fields hospital open and support mental health
attributes.background: Bushy fields hospitals dove house is used as a drop in centre for people suffering with mental health conditions

attributes.action: For Brexit Success: Abolish Business Rates and Make Up The Difference in VAT.
attributes.background: UK Businesses are grossly overcharged in business rates without bearing on the revenue they generate. Almost 4% of UK GDP is from these rates, verses 0.65% in the rest of Europe. UK businesses have to charge more to compensate, making them less competitive. Move to VAT would level the playing field.

attributes.action: I want a BAN on any child under 10 being allowed their ears pieced.
attributes.background: So by law if you were to put holes in another human beings body without permission then you'd be arrested for bodily harm, but parents believe they have the right to be doing this to babies and children, why can't a child have the right to ask for it to be done and choose to ruin their own bodies.

It's assault.

attributes.action: Enforce the Consumer Rights Act to protect music, arts and sport fans from touts
attributes.background: Fans are being ripped-off by ticket resales. The Consumer Rights Act has not changed this. We demand that Parliament enact last year’s ticket resale amendment, which provides tougher sanctions for resale websites, and also require ticket resellers to reveal their identities.

attributes.action: Make the Law Society the only regulatory body for Solicitors
attributes.background: The SRA and the Law Society coexist but the Law Society traditionally are the body that was formed on the 2 June 1825 that regulated solicitors up until the formation of the SRA in 2007. The SRA offer nothing different from the Law Society and are just an added expense to solicitors and taxpayers.

attributes.action: Equip all police officers with firearms on and off duty to deal with terror.
attributes.background: Equip all police officers with firearms on and off duty to deal with terror threats promptly with no waiting time for specialist units to attend the scene. Increase the fitness standard of all police officers and provide all officers firearms training. Only equip officers that meet the standard.

attributes.action: Permanently seize any vehicle used by a drink/drug driver following a conviction
attributes.background: Once a person is convicted of drink/drug driving they keep the vehicle that was used during the commission of the offence. This could be following a 12 - 24 month ban passed by a court. The vehicle will usually remain outside the home address of the person convicted, until temptation to use it hits.

attributes.action: Theresa May MUST make statement to Parliament if Trump visit Petition rejected.
attributes.background: If Theresa May rejects the Petition to ban Trump on the grounds of "It would "undo everything" achieved in talks with Donald Trump" she MUST make a statement to Parliament to explain EXACTLY what she achieved on her visit to the US and why banning Trump would put that at risk.

attributes.action: Make Enhanced DBS Checks a Legal Requirement for all MPs.
attributes.background: As a Health Professional I was surprised to learn that MPs, unlike other Public Servants in a position of trust, are not routinely required to have an Enhanced DBS check as a condition of their employment. MPs should be honest, trustworthy and above reproach, so background checks are reasonable.
attributes.additional_details:
I looked into background checks because the recent "Brexit" referendum raised doubts about the professional ethics and integrity of some of the MPs involved.

In 2014 North East MP Helen Goodman called for MPs to have "the same sort of checks as teachers and youth workers." As far as I'm aware this hasn't happened yet and is long overdue.

http://www.thejournal.co.uk/news/north-east-news/criminal-checks-needed-make-sure-7386465

attributes.action: Give a higher bursary to areas that are more deprived.
attributes.background: For some students £60/£100 over 12 weeks to cover travelling cost and lunch, is simply not enough.
attributes.additional_details: New schools are funded for bursaries on the assumption that 36% of students will be eligible, this is the national average. A higher level of deprivation area such as Newham will have a higher percentage that will need support whereas a Sixth from/College/Universities in an affluent area will have hardly any that need support. So, therefore, educational facilities in deprived areas must spread a small amount amongst many students, while educational institutions in affluent areas have more money than they need, which is not fair they should fund based on local needs, not the national average and in special cases fund specific students a lot more.

attributes.action: Allow Tax Relief on Commuting to Work Costs
attributes.background:
Allow commuters to claim income tax relief on the cost of travelling to work. 
Commuters spend their own money to travel to work. Fuel & public transport costs rise and it costs more per year to get to work. 
▼More details
attributes.additional_details:
House prices force people out of areas & make more expensive commutes. Where workers live & where companies are located could be positively influenced by such a move.

If all workers had the opportunity to claim tax relief on their annual commute this would ease the housing market, create job mobility and employment in more regions. 
It is unfair, unreasonable & damaging to the mindset of all employees that they are taxed to go to work. It is an unfair burden on hard working people.

attributes.action: Populate the Isle of Wight with Deer
attributes.background: Currently there are only a handful of deer on the Isle of Wight due to everytime any are spotted they are exterminated but I think that having deer on the island if controlled satisfactorily would be a good asset for the island.

attributes.action: 2 p should be put on income tax solely for the purpose of funding NHS resources
attributes.background: Background??? - look around - ask people - take a (cynical) look at the news - ask your GP - ask the next person you see in a wheelchair - visit any oncology unit - If nothing's done a lot of people will die a cold, lonely, painful, hideous death

attributes.action: Parliament to amend the law, requiring all councils to provide textile recycling
attributes.background:
Textile recycling should be introduced as mandatory into every single home in the U.K. 
There should also be a module introduced into schools on the importance of recycling & social responsibility. Communicating the textile recycling message to both homedwellers and dependants educated in the U.K.
attributes.additional_details:
The U.K clothing sector is responsible for more than 3m tonnes of co2 emissions.
consuming 2.16m tonnes of clothing and textiles/year, spending approx £38.4bn on clothing alone.

Households in the uk send more than 18.8m tonnes of rubbish (1.4m textiles) to landfill every year-2m tonnes more than EU counterparts.

U.K landfill rates are growing faster each year, emitting methane gas and accelerating climate change.

Anyone serious about tackling global warming should support efforts to recycle.

attributes.action: Stop outsourcing assessments for PIP and make fit for Mental Health sufferers.
attributes.background: The current assessment trivialises common issues like depression and anxiety and does not take these into consideration when deciding these claims. The form and the assessor only consider physical ailments and not how mental ability often prevent physical ability and is tantamount to discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: ATOS Healthcare also often misrepresent an individuals needs and conversations they have had during PIP assessments and this has been well documented in the press and many websites previously. Here are a couple of examples: http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/new-claims-of-atos-assessment-lies-are-tip-of-a-massive-iceberg/ and http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/atos-nurse-lied-about-pip-claimant-attending-assessment-alone/

attributes.action: More funding to domestic violence charities and provide more shelter for victims
attributes.background: We are a group of Year 10 students at Greenwood Academy in Birmingham. We believe not enough is done to support men and women who are victims of domestic violence. We want to see groups like Refuge get more funding to shelter victims and offer financial support to relocate them.

attributes.action: Make eateries develop a menu accessible and readable for all
attributes.background: After a recent meal out with people with learning disabilities I found myself wondering why, with all the focus on rights and choice there was no easy read menu. One non-verbal service user had to just eat what was chosen for him, whereas if there were menus with photos he could choose for himself.
attributes.additional_details: It would not take much for restaurants and cafes to develop a photo menu, as well as a menu in braille. There is huge focus on treating people equally in society these days, yet in so many establishments a large amount of the population are ignored. We now have wheelchair access in most places for physically disabled people so it's about time all disabled people were considered.

attributes.action: Cyclists should have legally registered identification plates on their cycles.
attributes.background: This is to enable identification of, and consequences for, cyclists who break road traffic laws and cause minor or major road incidents.
attributes.additional_details: There have been previous attempts to pass such laws but they have been generally tied in with the introduction of proposed insurance and road tax for cyclists.  Most cyclists, however, also own cars and so the concept of paying for road tax and insurance twice is an incredibly controversial one.  In order to keep this proposal straightforward, I am suggesting simply that cycle registration becomes compulsory in the same way car registration is, as a means of identification.

attributes.action: End the Housing Crisis
attributes.background: We are in a housing crisis and something needs to desperately be done such as these initiatives below;
attributes.additional_details:
Give Bursaries/reduce restrictions on brownfield sites, especially to smaller housing companies; This will allow for more building, with the added benefit of being more sustainable.

That each development must have a specified % of council, affordable,  single-living & various bedroom houses available, so to meet the needs of the whole community.

A law that after a developer has received their planning permission, they have a specified amount of time in which to finish their build.
